title: Cape Lookout National Seashore: Multimedia Presentations
body: Multimedia Presentations       View the seashore through the eyes of a Ranger. Get a glimpse into the nesting habits of some of the birds and turtles that live in and around Cape Lookout National Seashore and see the islands like you never have before!  Â       Video Podcasts What bird can indicate when an island is unhealthy? How big do sea turtles get? Where are all the pelican chicks? These answers and more can be found in Cape Lookout's video podcasts:  You're Healthy, but How is Your Island? The Eastern Brown Pelican Royal Terns and Sandwich Terns Life of a Loggerhead  Panoramic Flash Videos Tour the lighthouse and grounds--including places closed to the public--through these flash videos.  The Lantern Room - created by Dr. Laddie M. Crisp, Jr. The Lighthouse Grounds View of Core Sound from the Lighthouse Gallery View of the Cape from the Lighthouse Gallery  Because the Cape Lookout lighthouse is still a working aide to navigation, the lantern room is closed to the public. The lighthouse up to the watch room and gallery (just below the lantern room) is open seasonally for lighthouse climbs.
